for the staff, for the administration, for

1816.text:
the President, Jerry Falwell Jr. We covet
your prayers. Let me pray for you, and then

1821.text:
I'm going to let you go. 
Our Father, we thank You for every student

1825.text:
who is here. Not only are the students an
answer to prayer, but the chairs are an answer

1830.text:
to prayer, and this building's an answer to
prayer. And we thank You for our present leader,

1836.text:
Jerry Falwell Jr. We thank You for Becky.
We thank You for those who lead us in this

1841.text:
hour. And we pray that as we address the world,
and as the world looks on and speaks of us

1847.text:
with stereotypical language and says all kinds
of things about us, we pray that we will never

1852.text:
lose sight of who we really are. We are Liberty.
We celebrate the Gospel. We celebrate a God

1860.text:
who is filled with love, and compassion, and
grace, and mercy—a God who speaks truth

1866.text:
to us and helps us find our way, a God who
gives to a wisdom wherever we need it. And

1873.text:
then, our Father, we celebrate the calling
to imitate You, and we pledge ourselves to

1879.text:
that as our highest purpose. Bless each student.
Bless each class. Bless us as we leave this

1885.text:
place, we pray. It's through Christ our Lord,
Amen. God bless you.
